topic.title: hi my website has no peers, wut do i do so that other people can see it?

1510946916_1BrGZNxToC56H726jqXuUNuR6M8nn.body:
> [glightstar](#comment_22_14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy): In addition to that, you might want to think about opening zeronet's port! [...]

Ugh I feared this. I'm at an apartment so I can't control the router settings. *fuck*.

here's my address btw http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JULPR5a2Lse5TcU6eGp7FFcoTPhMyg5gS

I'm not sure if there's anything there, since I only created and updated the site from the machine without router access.

(Also connecting with tor to ZeroNet fails. And Tor from Zeronet shows an error. This is a fresh install.)

> [zerocateu](#comment_1_1QLQK7jRVb9AeziriC8t7ytHcQfdpv1WkV): Link works fine for me.

Wait, there's an actual website there? Nothing empty?

> [happyrabbit](#comment_5_1Hd7H8VUbdieey29AGC2xLxedDiPdM7JTT): well im seeding it now as we speak

thank you.. maybe I can share the files with someone with an open port.
